ground_truth: She can't go on. She lifts her face to his, and he kisses her gently. He looks into her eyes, then he does kiss her as though it were going to be the last time. Her hand falls to the table and knocks over a glass. It's raining very hard at the train station, and there is a hectic, fevered excitement, evident in the faces of the people that pass by. Rick appears in the crowd, stops, puts his suitcase down, and glances at his watch. He nervously checks his watch again, rain pouring over his head and shoulders, but he doesn't seem to notice. Suddenly Sam appears, pulls an envelope from his pocket, and Rick grabs it, opens it, and stares down at the letter, as raindrops pour down the letter, smudging the writing. Sam pulls a stunned, reluctant Rick to the train, which starts to move just as he boards. From the steps he looks off into the distance, then crumbles the letter and tosses it away as the steam from the engine clouds over him. A close-up of a glass on the table in the cafe is shown, and Rick's hand reaches for it and knocks it over. We now see Rick's face and he's very drunk. Sam walks over to the table to pick up the glass and a fallen chair. Just then the door opens and it's Ilsa. Rick stares at the doorway. Ilsa lingers a moment, then comes over to the table, her manner a little uncertain, a little tentative, but with a quiet determination beneath it. Rick reaches for the bottle, and pours himself another drink. She sits down in the chair before the empty glass, her eyes searching his face, but there is no expression on it except a cold and impassive one. He takes a drink. Ilsa gets up and leaves, and Rick's head slumps over the table. Strasser sits while Renault attends to some paperwork and looks at him. Laszlo and Ilsa make their way through the jam in the lobby of the Prefecture, as Jan and Annina talk to an officer. Laszlo and Ilsa enter Renault's office, and Renault bows to them both. Close-ups of Ilsa and then Laszlo reveal their disappointment, observed by Strasser. Renault rings a buzzer and the door is opened for them. As Ilsa and Laszlo leave, an officer comes in. Signor Ferrari turns around, pleased to see Rick, and they shake hands. He hails a waiter, eyes Rick closely, and Rick looks out of the window and sees Ilsa at the linen bazaar, then Laszlo walking toward the cafe. Rick isn't listening to him, looking through the open window in the direction of the linen bazaar. Rick gets up.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: She cannot continue. She raises her visage to his, and he pecks her softly. He gazes into her orbs, then he does smooch her as though it were going to be the final instance. Her palm drops to the desk and knocks over a tumbler. It's pouring very hard at the railway depot, and there is a frenzied, fevered excitement, evident in the visages of the individuals that pass by. Rick emerges in the throng, halts, places his valise down, and glances at his chronometer. He anxiously checks his chronometer again, rain streaming over his head and shoulders, but he does not seem to notice. Suddenly Sam materializes, extracts an envelope from his pocket, and Rick seizes it, opens it, and gazes down at the missive, as raindrops cascade down the letter, blurring the script. Sam drags a shocked, hesitant Rick to the train, which begins to move just as he boards. From the steps he looks off into the expanse, then crumples the letter and hurls it away as the vapor from the engine enshrouds him. A close-up of a chalice on the desk in the cafe is shown, and Rick's hand reaches for it and knocks it over. We now observe Rick's visage and he's very inebriated. Sam strides over to the desk to retrieve the chalice and a toppled seat. Just then the portal opens and it's Ilsa. Rick peers at the entrance. Ilsa hesitates a moment, then approaches the desk, her demeanor a little unsure, a little tentative, but with a quiet resolve beneath it. Rick reaches for the decanter, and pours himself another libation. She settles down in the seat before the vacant chalice, her orbs searching his visage, but there is no expression on it except a frigid and impassive one. He takes a sip. Ilsa rises and departs, and Rick's head slumps over the desk. Strasser seats while Renault attends to some documentation and gazes at him. Laszlo and Ilsa make their way through the jam in the lobby of the Prefecture, as Jan and Annina converse with an official. Laszlo and Ilsa enter Renault's bureau, and Renault inclines to them both. Close-ups of Ilsa and then Laszlo expose their disillusionment, observed by Strasser. Renault rings a bell and the entrance is opened for them. As Ilsa and Laszlo depart, an official arrives. Signor Ferrari pivots around, delighted to encounter Rick, and they clasp hands. He summons a server, scrutinizes Rick closely, and Rick gazes out of the aperture and sees Ilsa at the fabric marketplace, then Laszlo approaching the cafe. Rick is not heeding him, looking through the open aperture in the direction of the fabric marketplace. Rick rises.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: She can't continue. Her face is lifted by her to his, and she is kissed gently by him. Her eyes are looked into by him, then he kisses her as though it were going to be the last time. The table is struck by her hand, and a glass is knocked over by it. Rain is falling very hard at the train station, and the faces of the people who pass by show a hectic, fevered excitement. Rick is seen appearing in the crowd; he stops, puts his suitcase down, and glances at his watch. His watch is checked nervously by him again, with rain pouring over his head and shoulders, but no notice is taken by him. Suddenly, Sam is seen appearing, an envelope is pulled from his pocket by him, and it is grabbed by Rick, opened, and stared at, as raindrops pour down the letter, smudging the writing. A stunned, reluctant Rick is pulled by Sam to the train, which starts moving just as he boards it. The distance is looked off into by him from the steps, then the letter is crumbled by him and tossed away as the steam from the engine clouds over him. A close-up is shown of a glass on the table in the cafe, and it is reached for by Rick's hand and knocked over. Rick's face is now seen, and he is very drunk. The glass and a fallen chair are picked up by Sam, who walks over to the table. Just then, the door is opened, and it is Ilsa. The doorway is stared at by Rick. Ilsa lingers a moment, then the table is approached by her, her manner a little uncertain, a little tentative, but with a quiet determination beneath it. The bottle is reached for by Rick, and another drink is poured for himself. The chair before the empty glass is sat down in by her, her eyes searching his face, but the only expression on it is a cold and impassive one. A drink is taken by him. Ilsa gets up and leaves, and his head slumps over the table. Renault sits while some paperwork is attended to by Strasser and looks at him. The jam in the lobby of the Prefecture is made their way through by Laszlo and Ilsa, as an officer is talked to by Jan and Annina. Renault's office is entered by Laszlo and Ilsa, and they are both bowed to by Renault. Close-ups of Ilsa and then Laszlo reveal their disappointment, which is observed by Strasser. A buzzer is rung by Renault, and the door is opened for them. An officer enters as Ilsa and Laszlo leave. Rick is seen by Signor Ferrari, who turns around, pleased, and hands are shaken by them. A waiter is hailed by him, Rick is eyed closely, and the window is looked out of by Rick, where Ilsa is seen at the linen bazaar, then Laszlo walking toward the cafe. Signor Ferrari is not listened to by Rick, as he looks through the open window in the direction of the linen bazaar. He gets up.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: She can't continue. She raises her face to his, and he kisses her tenderly. He gazes into her eyes and kisses her as if it were the last time. Her hand falls, knocking over a glass. It's raining heavily at the train station, with people exhibiting a hectic excitement. Rick appears, stops, places his suitcase down, and checks his watch nervously as rain drenches him. Sam arrives, handing him an envelope. Rick opens it, the rain smudging the letter. Sam pulls a reluctant Rick to the train, which departs as he boards. From the steps, he crumples the letter and throws it away as steam envelops him. A close-up shows a glass on the cafe table, which Rick's hand knocks over. He's visibly drunk. Sam picks up the glass and chair. Ilsa enters, and Rick stares. She approaches with uncertainty but quiet determination. Rick pours another drink. She sits, searching his face, finding only coldness. Ilsa leaves, and Rick slumps over the table. Strasser sits as Renault works. Laszlo and Ilsa navigate the Prefecture lobby, and enter Renault's office, greeted with bows. Close-ups show their disappointment, observed by Strasser. Renault rings a buzzer for their exit. An officer enters. Signor Ferrari greets Rick warmly, sizing him up as Rick watches Ilsa at the linen bazaar, ignoring Ferrari. Rick stands.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: She can't continue. She lifts her face, and he kisses her gently, then deeply, as if it were their last. Her hand knocks over a glass. It's pouring rain at the station, bustling with excitement. Rick, amid the crowd, checks his watch nervously, despite the rain drenching him. Sam arrives, hands him an envelope, and Rick reads it as rain smudges the writing. Sam drags a stunned Rick onto the moving train. Rick crumples the letter and tosses it as steam envelops him. Back in the café, a close-up shows Rick knocking over a glass, drunk. Sam picks it up, and Ilsa enters hesitantly, determined. Rick drinks, showing no emotion. Ilsa leaves, and Rick slumps over the table. Strasser and Renault are in the office. Laszlo and Ilsa enter, greeted by Renault, revealing their disappointment. Renault opens the door for them. Rick meets Signor Ferrari, who hails a waiter and observes Rick, who watches Ilsa and Laszlo outside, uninterested in Ferrari. Rick rises.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: She simply cannot continue any longer. Lifting her face tenderly to meet his gaze, she receives his gentle, soft kiss. He peers deeply into her eyes, and then he kisses her again, this time with a fervor as if it were the final opportunity he would ever have. Her hand drops onto the table, and in doing so, it accidentally knocks over a tall, delicate glass. Meanwhile, outside, the rain is coming down in torrents at the bustling train station, where a sense of hectic, fevered excitement is palpable, visible on the faces of the numerous people hurriedly passing by. Among the crowd, Rick makes his appearance, and after stopping abruptly, he places his suitcase down on the wet ground and casually looks at his watch. With nervous energy, he checks his watch once more, uncaring of the rain that is relentlessly pouring over his head and dampening his shoulders, as it seems to go entirely unnoticed by him. Suddenly, Sam emerges from the throng, producing an envelope from his pocket, which Rick swiftly grabs, opens, and intensely gazes at the letter within, the raindrops smearing and distorting the writing. Sam then leads a somewhat stunned and reluctant Rick toward the train, which conveniently begins to move just as he manages to hop aboard. From the steps of the train, he gazes off into the vast distance, then crumples the letter in his hand and discards it, allowing it to be enveloped by the steam billowing from the engine. The scene transitions to a close-up view of a glass on a café table, and Rick's hand, rather carelessly, reaches out and accidentally tips it over. The camera now focuses on Rick's face, revealing that he is quite inebriated. Sam approaches the table, bending over to pick up not only the fallen glass but also an overturned chair. At that moment, the door swings open, revealing Ilsa standing there. Rick fixes his gaze upon the doorway, and Ilsa hesitates for a brief moment before slowly making her way over to the table. Her demeanor is somewhat uncertain, a bit tentative, yet there is a quiet determination underlying her actions. Rick reaches out for the bottle and proceeds to pour himself another drink. She settles into the chair positioned before the now-empty glass, her eyes searching his face for some sign of emotion, though all she finds is a cold, impassive look. Rick takes a sip of his drink. Without a word, Ilsa rises from her seat and departs, leaving Rick to slump his head over the table in desolation. At another location, Strasser sits as Renault attends to some paperwork, casting glances in his direction. Laszlo and Ilsa navigate through the crowded lobby of the Prefecture, as Jan and Annina engage an officer in conversation. Entering Renault's office, Laszlo and Ilsa receive bows from Renault. Close-up shots of both Ilsa and Laszlo reveal a deep disappointment, observed keenly by Strasser. With the press of a buzzer, the door is opened for their exit. As Ilsa and Laszlo leave, an officer makes his entrance. At another corner, Signor Ferrari turns with evident pleasure to see Rick, and they exchange a firm handshake. Calling over a waiter, Ferrari studies Rick intently, while Rick's gaze is directed outside the window, observing Ilsa at the linen bazaar, and then notices Laszlo approaching the cafe. Although Ferrari attempts conversation, Rick pays him little mind, remaining focused on looking through the open window in the burlap direction of the linen bazaar. Eventually, Rick rises from his seat.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
She finds herself utterly unable to continue any longer. Gently lifting her weary face to meet his unwavering gaze, she receives his soft, tender kiss with a depth of emotion. As he peers deeply and intently into her eyes, he leans in to kiss her once more, but this time there is a palpable fervor, almost as if this moment were the last opportunity he would ever have to do so. Her hand slips and drops onto the table, inadvertently knocking over a tall, delicate glass in the process. 

Simultaneously, outside, the rain is pouring down in relentless torrents at the bustling train station, where a sense of hectic, fevered excitement is almost tangible, visible in the expressions and hurried movements of the numerous individuals busily passing by. Amid the crowd, Rick makes his appearance, and after abruptly coming to a halt, he places his suitcase down on the wet, rain-soaked ground and casually checks his watch. With a nervous energy, he checks his watch once more, seemingly oblivious to the rain that is continuously pouring over his head, dampening his shoulders, as he appears completely unaffected by it. 

In a spontaneous moment, Sam emerges from the throng, producing an envelope from his pocket, which Rick swiftly grabs, tears open, and intensely gazes at the letter contained within, the raindrops smearing and distorting the writing beyond recognition. Sam then leads a somewhat stunned and reluctant Rick toward the train, which, with perfect timing, begins to move just as he manages to hop aboard. From the steps of the moving train, he gazes out into the vast expanse of distance, then crumples the letter in his hand and discards it, allowing it to be enveloped by the steam that billows from the powerful locomotive engine. 

The scene transitions seamlessly to a close-up view of a glass precariously positioned on a café table, and Rick's hand, rather absent-mindedly, reaches out and accidentally tips it over. The camera now focuses sharply on Rick's face, revealing that he is considerably inebriated. Sam approaches the table, carefully bending over to pick up not only the fallen glass but also an overturned chair. At that very moment, the door swings open with a sudden flourish, revealing Ilsa standing in the doorway. Rick fixes his gaze intently upon the entrance, and Ilsa hesitates for a fleeting moment before she slowly makes her way over to the table. Her demeanor is somewhat uncertain, a bit tentative, yet there is an unmistakable quiet determination underlying her actions. 

Rick reaches out for the bottle, and proceeds to pour himself another drink. She settles into the chair positioned before the now-empty glass, her eyes searching his face for some sign, any hint of emotion, though all she finds is a cold, impassive look. Rick takes a deliberate sip of his drink. Without uttering a single word, Ilsa rises from her seat and departs, leaving Rick to slump his head over the table in utter desolation.

In another location, Strasser sits composedly as Renault attends to a stack of paperwork, casting curious glances in his direction. Laszlo and Ilsa navigate their way through the crowded lobby of the Prefecture, while Jan and Annina engage an officer in conversation. Entering Renault's office, Laszlo and Ilsa are greeted with polite bows from Renault. Close-up shots of both Ilsa and Laszlo reveal a deep-seated disappointment, observed keenly and shrewdly by Strasser. With the press of a buzzer, the door swings open to permit their exit. As Ilsa and Laszlo leave, an officer steps in to make his entrance.

In another corner of this unfolding drama, Signor Ferrari turns with evident pleasure upon seeing Rick, and they exchange a firm, cordial handshake. Calling over a waiter with a gesture, Ferrari studies Rick intently, while Rick's gaze is directed unwaveringly outside the window, observing Ilsa at the linen bazaar, then noticing Laszlo's approach toward the café. Although Ferrari attempts to engage Rick in conversation, Rick pays him little heed, remaining singularly focused on looking through the open window in the burlap-lined direction of the lively linen bazaar. Eventually, with deliberate motion, Rick rises from his seat.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: She feels she cannot continue and slowly raises her face to meet his, prompting him to lean in and gently press his lips against hers, a soft and tender connection. He then fixes his gaze on her eyes, deeply absorbing the moment, before kissing her again, this time with an intensity and passion as if it were their very last farewell. Her hand, devoid of strength and resolve, collapses onto the table, inadvertently colliding with a glass and sending it toppling over. Meanwhile, the train station is engulfed in a heavy downpour, each raindrop amplifying the atmosphere's frenetic energy, mirrored in the expressions of the bustling crowd. Amidst this bustling scene, Rick emerges, carefully making his way through the throng. He comes to an abrupt halt, gently sets his suitcase down, and takes a quick glance at his watch, a gesture tinged with urgency and impatience. His eyes dart to his watch once more, oblivious to the sheets of rain streaming down his head and shoulders and drenching him completely. In a sudden shift of events, Sam materializes out of the crowd, swiftly extracting an envelope from his pocket. Rick hastily snatches it, tears it open, and lets his eyes fall onto the letter held within, even as the relentless rain blurs and smudges the inked words. Sam, sensing Rick's hesitation, firmly grasps his arm, urging and almost dragging the startled Rick toward the waiting train, which begins to pull away just as Rick steps on board. Standing on the steps, Rick's gaze fixes on the distant horizon, grappling with a maelstrom of emotions, before his resolve crumbles, matching the letter he crumples and discards carelessly into the swirling steam enveloping him. In sharp contrast, the scene transitions back to the cafe where a close-up reveals a glass on the table, only to be knocked over by Rick's unsteady hand. The camera pans up to reveal Rick's face, his features heavy with the unmistakable signs of inebriation. Sam approaches, dutifully gathering the overturned glass and righting a fallen chair nearby, restoring some semblance of order. Just as Sam finishes, the door swings open, revealing Ilsa standing in the threshold. Rick's eyes lock onto the doorway, taking in the sight of Ilsa as she pauses briefly, her demeanor tinged with uncertainty yet underscored by a quiet resolve. She proceeds over to the table, her movements measured and gentle, and finally lowers herself into the chair before the vacant glass, her eyes gently probing his face for any trace of warmth, only to be met with his cold, impassive exterior. In response, he reaches for the bottle with a steady hand, pouring another drink to fortify himself. Ilsa, sensing the futility, rises from her seat and withdraws, leaving Rick to slump forward, his head heavy on the table. The scene shifts to Strasser seated while Renault, preoccupied, attends to paperwork, casting a glance at him. Simultaneously, Laszlo and Ilsa navigate through the dense crowd cluttering the Prefecture's lobby as Jan and Annina engage an officer in conversation. With poise, Laszlo and Ilsa approach Renault's office entrance, and as they step inside, Renault greets them with a courteous bow. Their faces, caught in close-up, betray their disappointment, an emotion keenly observed by Strasser. Without hesitation, Renault presses a buzzer to signal departure, and the door is ceremoniously opened to facilitate their exit. As they leave, an officer enters the scene, signaling a change of pace. Meanwhile, Signor Ferrari, upon encountering Rick, turns with a welcoming smile and they exchange a warm handshake. Ferrari calls a waiter, his eyes scrutinizing Rick, who is meanwhile absorbed in the view outside, his gaze drifting toward the linen bazaar where Ilsa can be seen, and further beyond to where Laszlo is approaching the cafe. Rick remains disengaged from Ferrari's words, his attention utterly consumed by the scene framed within the open window, and what it portends, prompting him to rise decisively from his seat.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
She can't continue and lifts her face to him for a gentle kiss, followed by a more intense one as if it were their last. Her hand accidentally knocks over a glass as the scene shifts to a bustling, rainy train station, alive with frenetic energy. In the crowd, Rick appears, sets down his suitcase, and anxiously checks his watch, seemingly unaware of the rain soaking him. Sam suddenly arrives, hands Rick an envelope, and Rick reads the letter as the rain smudges the ink. Sam pulls a hesitant Rick onto the departing train. Rick throws the crumpled letter away, shrouded in engine steam.

In a cafe, Rick's drunken hand knocks over a glass. Sam tidies up around him just as Ilsa enters, her manner uncertain yet quietly determined. Rick coldly drinks while Ilsa sits opposite him, searching his emotionless face. She soon leaves, and Rick's head falls to the table. Elsewhere, Strasser observes Renault attending to paperwork. Laszlo and Ilsa navigate the crowded lobby to Renault's office, where they are greeted with bows. Disappointment is evident on their faces, noticed by Strasser. As they depart, an officer enters. Meanwhile, Signor Ferrari greets Rick warmly before they shake hands. Ferrari signals a waiter while observing Rick, who is distractedly watching Ilsa and Laszlo near the linen bazaar. Rick rises from his seat, lost in thought.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: She can't go on, overwhelmed by the weight of their circumstances in the dimly lit room of the Parisian apartment. She lifts her face to his, and he kisses her gently. He looks into her eyes, then he does kiss her as though it were going to be the last time, their separation inevitable amid the chaos of World War II. Her hand falls to the table and knocks over a glass, spilling remnants of the fine French wine they had been sharing. It's raining very hard at the train station, a bustling hub of departures and reunions common during the war, and there is a hectic, fevered excitement, evident in the faces of the people that pass by, each with their own urgent story. Rick appears in the crowd, a man marked by his past and yet searching for a future, stops, puts his suitcase down, and glances at his watch, a family heirloom. He nervously checks his watch again, rain pouring over his head and shoulders in sheets, but he doesn't seem to notice, his mind elsewhere. Suddenly Sam, his loyal friend and confidant from their time in Casablanca, appears, pulls an envelope from his pocket, and Rick grabs it, opens it, and stares down at the letter detailing a new safe passage, as raindrops pour down the letter, smudging the writing. Sam pulls a stunned, reluctant Rick to the train, which starts to move just as he boards. From the steps he looks off into the distance, then crumbles the letter and tosses it away into the wind as the steam from the engine clouds over him, symbolizing his unresolved feelings. A close-up of a glass on the table in the cafe is shown, and Rick's hand reaches for it and knocks it over as if mirroring his inner turmoil. We now see Rick's face and he's very drunk, drowning his sorrows. Sam walks over to the table to pick up the glass and a fallen chair, knowing too well the depths of Rick's despair. Just then the door opens and it's Ilsa, the woman who once shattered his heart in Paris. Rick stares at the doorway. Ilsa lingers a moment, then comes over to the table, her manner a little uncertain, a little tentative, but with a quiet determination beneath it, driven by the need to find closure. Rick reaches for the bottle, and pours himself another drink, trying to maintain his composure. She sits down in the chair before the empty glass, her eyes searching his face for any sign of the man she once loved, but there is no expression on it except a cold and impassive one, crafted by years of heartache. He takes a drink. Ilsa gets up and leaves, and Rick's head slumps over the table, weighed down by a mixture of alcohol and regret. Strasser, a German officer known for his cunning and ruthless nature, sits while Renault, the Vichy official with shifting loyalties, attends to some paperwork and looks at him. Laszlo, a leader of the Resistance, and Ilsa make their way through the jam in the lobby of the Prefecture, a place of bureaucratic power and control, as Jan and Annina, refugees seeking escape, talk to an officer. Laszlo and Ilsa enter Renault's office, and Renault bows to them both, masking his intentions. Close-ups of Ilsa and then Laszlo reveal their disappointment, observed by Strasser, who watches for any sign of weakness. Renault rings a buzzer and the door is opened for them, a signal for their departure. As Ilsa and Laszlo leave, an officer comes in, interrupting the tense moment. Signor Ferrari, the shrewd owner of the Blue Parrot nightclub, turns around, pleased to see Rick, and they shake hands, an alliance of convenience. He hails a waiter, eyes Rick closely, assessing his next move, and Rick looks out of the window and sees Ilsa at the linen bazaar, a place teeming with vibrant fabrics and merchants haggling over prices, then Laszlo walking toward the cafe. Rick isn't listening to him, looking through the open window in the direction of the linen bazaar, lost in thoughts of what might have been. Rick gets up, driven by a sense of purpose amid the swirling currents of fate.

test_cases.description: She cannot go on. She lifts her face to his and he kisses her gently. He looks into her eyes then he does kiss her as though it were going to be the last time. Her hand falls to the table and knocks over a glass. It is raining very hard at the train station and there is a hectic fevered excitement evident in the faces of the people that pass by. Rick appears in the crowd stops puts his suitcase down and glances at his watch. He nervously checks his watch again. rain pouring over his head and shoulders but he does not seem to notice. Suddenly Sam appears pulls an envelope from his pocket and Rick grabs it opens it and stares down at the letter. as raindrops pour down the letter smudging the writing. Sam pulls a stunned reluctant Rick to the train which starts to move just as he boards. From the steps he looks off into the distance then crumbles the letter and tosses it away as the steam from the engine clouds over him. A closeup of a glass on the table in the cafe is shown and Rick's hand reaches for it and knocks it over. We now see Rick's face and he is very drunk. Sam walks over to the table to pick up the glass and a fallen chair. Just then the door opens and it is Ilsa. Rick stares at the doorway. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Ilsa lingers a moment then comes over to the table. her manner a little uncertain a little tentative but with a quiet determination beneath it. Rick reaches for the bottle and pours himself another drink. She sits down in the chair before the empty glass her eyes searching his face but there is no expression on it except a cold and impassive one. He takes a drink. Ilsa gets up and leaves and Rick's head slumps over the table. Strasser sits while Renault attends to some paperwork and looks at him. Laszlo and Ilsa make their way through the jam in the lobby of the Prefecture. as Jan and Annina talk to an officer Laszlo and Ilsa enter Renault's office and Renault bows to them both. Closeups of Ilsa and then Laszlo reveal their disappointment observed by Strasser. Renault rings a buzzer and the door is opened for them. As Ilsa and Laszlo leave an officer comes in. Signor Ferrari turns around pleased to see Rick and they shake hands. He hails a waiter eyes Rick closely and Rick looks out of the window and sees Ilsa at the linen bazaar. then Laszlo walking toward the cafe. Rick is not listening to him looking through the open window in the direction of the linen bazaar. Rick gets up.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: She can't continue and lifts her face to him; he kisses her gently, then passionately, as if it's their last moment. Her hand knocks over a glass. At the bustling, rainy train station, Rick stands anxious, checking his watch. Sam appears, handing him an envelope. Rick opens it, rain smudging the letter as Sam pulls him onto the moving train. Rick crumples the letter, tossing it away as he departs. Back at the cafe, Rick is drunk, knocking over another glass. Sam tidies up as Ilsa enters, hesitantly joining Rick at the table. He remains cold and impassive, pouring another drink. Ilsa leaves, and Rick slumps over. Strasser and Renault are in the office, while Laszlo and Ilsa meet Renault, their disappointment clear. Rick later meets Signor Ferrari, distracted as he sees Ilsa and Laszlo outside. Rick rises, lost in thought.

test_cases.name: Reverse Segments Order
test_cases.description: Rick gets up Rick is not listening to him looking through the open window in the direction of the linen bazaar then Laszlo walking toward the cafe He hails a waiter eyes Rick closely and Rick looks out of the window and sees Ilsa at the linen bazaar Signor Ferrari turns around pleased to see Rick and they shake hands As Ilsa and Laszlo leave an officer comes in Renault rings a buzzer and the door is opened for them Closeups of Ilsa and then Laszlo reveal their disappointment observed by Strasser as Jan and Annina talk to an officer Laszlo and Ilsa enter Renault's office and Renault bows to them both Laszlo and Ilsa make their way through the jam in the lobby of the Prefecture Strasser sits while Renault attends to some paperwork and looks at him Ilsa gets up and leaves and Rick's head slumps over the table He takes a drink She sits down in the chair before the empty glass her eyes searching his face but there is no expression on it except a cold and impassive one Rick reaches for the bottle and pours himself another drink her manner a little uncertain a little tentative but with a quiet determination beneath it Ilsa lingers a moment then comes over to the table Rick stares at the doorway Just then the door opens and it is Ilsa Sam walks over to the table to pick up the glass and a fallen chair We now see Rick's face and he is very drunk A closeup of a glass on the table in the cafe is shown and Rick's hand reaches for it and knocks it over From the steps he looks off into the distance then crumbles the letter and tosses it away as the steam from the engine clouds over him Sam pulls a stunned reluctant Rick to the train which starts to move just as he boards as raindrops pour down the letter smudging the writing Suddenly Sam appears pulls an envelope from his pocket and Rick grabs it opens it and stares down at the letter rain pouring over his head and shoulders but he does not seem to notice He nervously checks his watch again Rick appears in the crowd stops puts his suitcase down and glances at his watch It is raining very hard at the train station and there is a hectic fevered excitement evident in the faces of the people that pass by Her hand falls to the table and knocks over a glass He looks into her eyes then he does kiss her as though it were going to be the last time She lifts her face to his and he kisses her gently She cannot go on
